task.title: Seasoning New Cast Iron for First Use

ol.li: Wash the pan with warm soapy water to remove any factory residue.
Dry the pan thoroughly with a towel.
Apply a thin layer of vegetable oil or melted shortening to the enttire surface of the pan including the handle.
Place the pan upside down in a preheated oven at 350 degrees Farenheight for one hour.

Let the pan cool in the overn before removing it. Repeat this process if necessary until the pan develops a smooth, non-stick surface.
Avoid Soaking: Never soak your cast iron pan in water or leave it submerged for an extended period as it can lead to rust
Maintain Seasoning: After easch use, wipe the pan with a thin layer of oil to maintain its seasonin and prevent rust.
For more detailed instructions on seasoning your cast iron pan, refer to Lodge Seasoning and Care for Cast Iron.
